#Text=Niseko
#Text=Niseko ( ニセコ ) is a town and ski resort on the northern island of Hokkaido , Japan .
#Text=Understand

#Text=Niseko is an increasingly popular destination for powder hungry skiers and boarders , and nearly alone among Japan 's ski resorts is drawing increasing numbers of overseas visitors year-on-year as well .
#Text=Niseko is highly favored by Australians , and more recently , Asian tourists .
#Text=The resort boasts four ski areas : Hanazono , Hirafu , Niseko Village ( formerly Higashiyama ) and Annupuri .
#Text=Most activity is centered around the village of Hirafu , approximately 20 minutes from the main town and administrative centre in the area , Kutchan .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The nearest airport to Niseko is Sapporo 's New Chitose Airport , which receives flights from all over Japan and some international destinations as well .
#Text=There are direct international flights from most neighboring countries .
#Text=If you come from further far away often Nagoya ( Chubu ) or Seoul are most convenient transfers .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Skybus is a convenient door to door private airport transfer servicing all hotels in Niseko , operating 365 days a year .
#Text=Bookings are essential .
#Text=More information at Skybus
#Text=During winter months , numerous limousine bus services are provided to various ski resorts in Niseko at a cost of ¥1900-¥ 2300 each way .
#Text=In addition , two public bus lines run buses from New Chitose Airport ( CTS ) to Hirafu .
#Text=Both operate on a regular timetable during the ski season , with the Chuo Bus having 5 trips each way daily while Donan Buses have 4 each way .
#Text=Times are subject to change from season to season , but each can be contacted by phone ( Chuo-Bus +81 11 231 0500 , and Donan-Bus +81 123 465701 ) .
#Text=In the 2006/7 season , the cost of a one-way ticket is ¥ 2300 and a return is ¥ 3850 .
#Text=The trip takes about 3.5 - 4 hours , depending on the road conditions .
#Text=This is an excellent way to see the countryside , the snow covered farm lands and the quaint houses .
#Text=In the 2011/12 season both bus lines offer a discounted return ticket including a strongly discounted one-day ski pass .
#Text=By train

#Text=Reaching Niseko from Sapporo by train is a tricky affair , requiring a transfer of trains at Otaru , and perhaps a long wait as well ; there are only six daily local trains between Otaru and Niseko .
#Text=But , if it 's between December and March , and you decide to leave Sapporo at around 8:00 or 12:30 , you can get to Niseko on a direct train .
#Text=The limited express train , appropriately named the Niseko Ski-Express , makes the run in 2 hours at a cost of ¥ 4560 .
#Text=Return Ski-Express trains depart from Niseko at 10:00 and 16:00 .
#Text=There is no charge for this train with the Japan Rail Pass .
#Text=See
#Text=Mt . Yotei ( 羊蹄山 ) .
#Text=This 1,898m peak is directly opposite Hirafu at Niseko .
#Text=The peak makes for great views in the winter .
#Text=In the summer , many people climb it , and it is possible to stay on top of the mountain in the Mountain Hut ( 山小屋 ) .
#Text=This mountain is sometimes called Ezo Fuji ( 蝦夷富士 ) due to it 's strong resemblance to Japan 's iconic Mt . Fuji , with Ezo being the former official name for the island of Hokkaido .
#Text=Winter
#Text=Skiing .
#Text=Skiers love the deep , reliable powder , tree runs and relative ease to find untracked snow .
#Text=There are no real steeps here ( max slope is approx 35 degrees ) but there are lots of great runs , serviced by good quality lifts , most of which are gondolas or covered chairs .
#Text=Niseko is renowned for its huge amount of powder brought from Siberia by northern weather patterns .
#Text=Snowboarding .
#Text=Niseko is a snowboarder 's snowy-cultural paradise .
#Text=The area averages 12-16 meters of light snow every season to slide sideways , shred , surf and slash .

#Text=Niseko United includes the four resorts of Hanazono , Niseko Grand Hirafu , Niseko Village Higashiyama and Annupuri on one all mountain pass ( 29 lifts , 3 gondolas ) From deep powder runs to your pick of 3 terrain parks , Niseko offers a lot to enjoy .
#Text=Summer
#Text=Hiking .
#Text=In the summer , there are several wonderful day hikes .
#Text=Biking .
#Text=It 's possible to bike around Mount Yotei , by using the surrounding , mostly quiet , roads for a total of 52 kilometers .
#Text=Bike rental is available from various establishments , including Rhythm Japan , for around 4000 yen per day .
#Text=Tours are also available .
#Text=All Seasons
#Text=Onsen .
#Text=Onsens , Japanese hot springs , are popular places to relax .
#Text=Some are natural , and some are not .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Java Massage .
#Text=A great place to unwind and relax those well used muscles after a big day on the slopes .
#Text=Relaxation , remedial , deep tissue or sports massage .
#Text=Niseko Base Snowsports ( NBS ) , 190-34 Aza Yamada , Kutchan cho , Abuta gun , ☏ +81136215050 .
#Text=8AM-8PM .
#Text=English-speaking ski school and rental shop .
#Text=Located directly across from the Ace Family lift in the ground floor of Alpen Ridge .
#Text=Experienced team of international instructors provide adults and children 's lessons .
#Text=Rental equipment includes K2 , Aramada , Head and more .
#Text=On snow accessories for sale including shoe spikes , goggles , helmets and more from Oakley , Dakine and Smith .
#Text=Larry Adler Ski and Outdoor , ☏ +81 136-214050 .
#Text=open December to end of March .
#Text=Offers free overnight storage and a large range of Ski and Snowboard hire .
#Text=Best value in town and right next to the Ace Family lift .
#Text=Also sell Clothings , googles and gloves for your ski holiday .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The diversity and quality of Niseko 's cuisine scene is part of its appeal as a travel destination .
#Text=Eating out will definitely be one of the highlights of your visit to Hokkaido .
#Text=Local specialities include potatoes and seafood .
#Text=There are also a large number of restaurants that specialize in Italian , Korean , Indonesian , Thai , Nepalese and other ethnic foods .
#Text=Families on a budget will also be pleased with the variety of outlets offering quality meals at affordable prices .
#Text=Niseko Pizza ( ニセコピザ ) , 〒044-0081 北海道虻田郡倶知安町字山田１８８−９ , ☏ +81 136-21-6888 .

column3: 北海道虻田郡倶知安町字山田１８８−９

column1: #Text=A pizzeria , pasta , and cafe with a family atmosphere .
#Text=Sells pizza , salad , and bread baked in a stone-fired pizza oven .
#Text=Prepared with locally grown ingredients .
#Text=A-bu-Cha .
#Text=A bakery by day and Japanese izakaya by night .
#Text=Serves sweets , sandwiches , bagels , and baguettes .
#Text=Ezo Pub ( Inside Hilton Niseko Village ) .
#Text=Offers fresh-baked pizza and light meal selections .
#Text=Happy hour and drink discounts available .
#Text=Free shuttle bus to and from Hirafu .
#Text=Live DJ during ski season .
#Text=Onegiri Cafe Komekichi .
#Text=Offers Komekichi 's rice balls , made of freshly milled and steamed rice and filled with Hokkaido ingredients .
#Text=Also sells fresh-baked breads and soup .
#Text=Rest House
#Text=Ace Hill
#Text=.
#Text=Restaurant with nice views of Mt . Yotei and the top of Mt . Annupuri .
#Text=Bang Bang Cafe .
#Text=Japanese pub-style cuisine in the heart of Hirafu , with dishes like tofu and yakitori .
#Text=Specializes in Japanese and local dishes .
#Text=Fuji Sushi .
#Text=Fresh sushi and sashimi from the nearby Shakotan Peninsula .
#Text=Paradise Hut .
#Text=A cafe on the slopes of Niseko Annupuri mountain .
#Text=Melt Grill and Bar ( in the Hilton Niseko village ) .
#Text=A nice selection of local and imported cuts of prime beef , seafood and more .
#Text=Has nice value lunch deals .
#Text=1500円 lunch buffet .
#Text=EN In-house fine Dining .
#Text=The chefs cook a fantastic dinner in your holiday home .
#Text=This food catering company does delivery to all Niseko locations .
#Text=Niseko Gourmet .
#Text=Is a catering company which will come to your property , prepare and serve a meal and then clean up .
#Text=The 2nd floor is a tasty Mexican restaurant with burritos , quesadillas , tequila , and more .
#Text=On the first floor , there are two bars , one with a pool table , and the other with darts .
#Text=YUMMY'S Restaurant & Bar ( ヤミーズ ) , 〒044-0081 北海道虻田郡倶知安町字山田１７０−１７５ , ☏ +81 136-21-2239 .

column3: 北海道虻田郡倶知安町字山田１７０−１７５

column1: #Text=Handmade pizza , salads , cold beer , and music .
#Text=Yo , 155-416 Aza Yamada ( Lowder Hirafr Village ) , ☏ +81- 136-22-6979 .
#Text=Traditional Japanese cuisine with tasty sake and selected wines .
#Text=Free pick-up and Drop-off service in Hirafu village and Kutchan station ¥ 3000 - 4500.
#Text=Kabuki , 170 Aza Yamada ( 40m down from Seicomart ) , ☏ +81136212233 .
#Text=5-9.30pm.
#Text=Kabuki 1 is Okonomiyaki and Teppanyaki do it your self style , cook on your own hotplate .
#Text=Kabuki 2 is full service Teppanyaki were the skilled chefs cook as you like seafood , steak and various Japanese specialties .
